sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization's chief has declared a monkeypox global emergency as cases across Europe, North America and Africa continue to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian port city of Odessa comes under missile attack a day after Kiev and Moscow sign a key export agreement to get grain out of southern ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban delivers a controversial keynote speech at a summer university in Transylvania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Italian wildfires cross the border into Slovenia forcing residents to flee as the damage from blazes in France and Spain is revealed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization has declared the monkeypox outbreak a global health emergency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That's the health agency's highest level of alert.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Despite a lack of consensus among officials on the WHO's emergency committee, Director General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus made the decision without an expert recommendation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For all of these reasons, I have decided that the global monkeypox outbreak represents a public health emergency of international concern.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to the U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention, more than 16,000 cases of monkeypox have been reported in 74 countries since May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, some experts have questioned if such a declaration will help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They say most people recover without needing medical attention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This comes as the European Medicines Agency recommended smallpox vaccine Infinex to be used to treat the disease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UK, Canada, Germany and the US have already ordered millions of vaccine doses, but none have gone to Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: To date, monkeypox deaths have only been reported on the African continent, where a more dangerous version of the virus is spreading, mainly in Nigeria and Congo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But as cases rise across New York City, members of the LGBTQ plus community and their allies say the government hasn't done enough and are calling for an emergency fund to support more testing, access to vaccines and educational resources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: access to vaccines and educational resources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Missile strikes have hit the key Ukrainian port city of Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It comes not even a day after Moscow and Kiev signed an agreement to allow monitored grain exports from the country's southern ports, ports like Odessa. This latest attack on the city, one of the largest since the war began, has raised new doubts about the viability of the deal, which is intended to stave off famine in the developing world that could occur if grain isn't exported soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has blamed Russia, calling the strike a prime example of how Moscow could find ways not to implement the recently signed grain deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A spokesperson for Ukraine's foreign ministry added that it's a spit in the face of UN Secretary General António Guterres and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, who helped broker the agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The attack has already created international outrage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Josep Borrell, the EU's foreign affairs chief, said on Twitter that the bloc strongly condemned the strike, calling it reprehensible after the signing of the deal and calling into question Russia's regard for international law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is unclear what damage the port city sustained, but its infrastructure was targeted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Strikes also took place in other parts of Ukraine on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: An airfield and railway facility were hit in the Kirov-Voradska region, killing three people. According to the Turkish Ministry of Defence, Russia denies any involvement

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: in the Odessa attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán received a warm welcome on the final day of the summer university in Bialtuznad, Romania. The three-time prime minister took advantage of his keynote speech to further his controversial strategies and criticised progressive policies on immigration and gender.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There is a war, an energy crisis and war inflation, he said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And all of this draws a screen before our eyes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It draws a screen between us and gender and migration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In fact, the future raises these questions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is a great historical battle we are fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On demography, migration and gender, this is precisely what is at stake in the left-right fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The workshop held in eastern Transylvania aims to promote what organisers call cross-border cooperation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: While the nationalist conservative leader is one of the main attractions of the event, Brussels says corruption, the erosion of the free press and Orbán's excessive use of emergency powers remain major concerns after the European Commission released its annual rule of law report in mid-July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: European Commission released its annual rule of law report in mid-July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Italian wildfires have crossed the border into Slovenia, forcing residents and nearby villages to flee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Firefighters there are waging an all-out battle on land and from the air. The tough terrain has made it impossible to get to the center of the blaze, forcing emergency services to only fight of the blaze, forcing emergency services to only fight from the edges and above.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Greece's northwest, reinforcements have arrived to battle a new, threatening fire that broke out in a forest on Thursday. The vegetation consists mainly of pines, making their task a difficult one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in France, the damage from raging wildfires is slowly being revealed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Officials say a long and costly reforestation will follow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President Emmanuel Macron has promised to replant and rebuild after visiting the region of Giron, where more than 200,000 hectares have been scorched.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And the fire aftermath is coming to light in Spain too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Charred grapevines and gutted houses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The country's wildfires started in spring when Spaniards experienced the earliest heat wave in two decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The UN says the Mediterranean region is warming 20% faster than the global average.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Europe is staring into one of its driest summers in living memory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Drought alerts have been issued for much of the continent and a brutal heatwave is straining agricultural production and nature's resilience.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Portugal's apples and rocha pears are bearing the brunt of this new reality. It gets burnt like this and has no commercial value, farmer Pedro Bernardes says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This will have to be sent to the ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For us, it's a very considerable drop in income.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Portugal's soaring temperatures have burned tons of fruit, particularly in the western zone near the capital capital Lisbon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The ongoing drought in Romania has made potatoes there more expensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In central counties, it has rained very little, and the potato is a plant that requires plenty of water to reach maturity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in the south of the country, cracked earth is drying up corn crops. 500 hectares have been completely destroyed in the Madaris region. The current heat wave is scorching fields, with no signs of rain to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Not exactly the way you'd want to start your holidays, but queues like these are exactly what many holidaymakers trying to leave the UK and cross the Channel have faced in Dover.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Although the backlog is now starting to clear, the kilometre-long wait has created a new spat between the UK and French governments, with both sides mutually blaming each other for the delays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And there were similar scenes in other European countries like France, where the traffic was particularly dense around Paris and between Lyon and Valence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Authorities even noted a peak of nearly 790 kilometers of traffic jams at midday on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Croatia, as the tourist season reaches its peak, traffic has increased on all roads heading towards tourist destinations on the Adriatic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Passengers have been arriving in waves since the early hours of the morning. There are quite a lot of crowds when entering the ferry port. As for this weekend, we expect over 75,000 passengers and over 15,000 vehicles. The pressure is quite high, especially towards Subotar." And in Switzerland, holiday traffic at the Gotthard North portal was backed up for 15 kilometers, with waiting times of up to two and a half hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This glistening white bridge suspended above Croatia's Adriatic Sea opens to traffic in three days' time. And Croatians are counting down because the historic project will link the southernmost region with the rest of the country. The country's independence from Yugoslavia in 1991 left Croatia's Adriatic coast cut into two by a tiny stretch belonging to Bosnia. It is only now that we are becoming a part of Croatia, this shellfish farmer says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: People here were simply isolated and we were forced to travel through two border crossings to get to the rest of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Pelja-Šac bridge is part of a state road that goes around the Neum corridor and is part of the road connection with the Southern Dalmatia project. The 32.5-kilometre-long two-lane road connects the far south and creates a prerequisite for the development of the mainland and islands of the Dubrovnik region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Construction began in 2018. It was built by a Chinese consortium led by the China Road and Bridge Cooperation, and China's ambassador to Croatia says it will deepen the mutually beneficial relationship between the two nations and the European Union.
